about_the_game:
A Long Dark Night is a single-player first-person mystery set in the Gulf of Maine.

Embark on a moving journey as an angler navigating stormy waters with your dad.
In the shadow of your mom's passing five years ago, your simple life takes a paranormal turn when a mysterious ring reveals glimpses of someone else's past. This town, which is cursed by an ever-present storm, becomes the backdrop for your discovery: your mother is alive, yet changed.

As you and your dad unite to find her, unravel a compelling tale of love, loss, and a reality veiled in mystery.
Whose version of the past will you believe, your father's or your mother's? The truth awaits, and the choices you make will shape the course of this narrative-driven game.

Note: A Long Dark Night contains mature themes, including unwanted pregnancy, coercion, and domestic abuse.

Includes:

  • A beautiful seaside environment to explore.
  • An adaptive story with multiple endings: your choices shape the narrative and affect the outcome.
  • A gripping mystery that's filled with lies and unraveled through flashbacks.
  • Yet another satisfying fishing minigame.

Featuring:

  • A cast of living, breathing characters brought to life by voice actors (currently casting)
  • A spectacular seaside environment by David Bautista (ARISE, SpellBound AR)
  • A thrilling story and script by M.A. Starling (Heartstop, Irrational)
  • An original soundtrack by Guillaume Fabre
  • Fluid first-person animation.
  • Programming, gameplay scripting, production & design work by Chris Monteferrante (ARISE, SpellBound AR)

short_description: A Long Dark Night is a Lovecraftian narrative-driven game. Navigate the stormy Gulf of Maine, unraveling the truth behind your family's past. Explore a beautiful seaside, shape the narrative with your choices, and confront shocking revelations in this gripping story, taking place at sea.
